title: Digital Game-Based Collaborative Learning Design for Ethical Creativity Education

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary science education experience, basic digital tool proficiency, and foundational understanding of creativity education theory
context.additional_context: Program for pre-service teachers to explore integrating ethical creativity into science lesson design. Focuses on cultivating ethical decision-making competencies through collaborative creative problem-solving in digital game environments

learning_goals: Learners understand the concept of ethical creativity (WHC) and propose at least three strategies for applying it to science lesson design.
Learners analyze ethical dilemmas arising in creative problem-solving processes and propose solutions through digital game-based collaborative activities.

Learners will develop a draft of a science-integrated collaborative creativity assessment tool referencing the five core elements of the C2Learn framework (content integration, collaborative learning, creativity promotion, assessment system, technology utilization) and secure validity scores of â‰¥4 points (5-point scale) in peer review.
Learners design science lesson scenarios reflecting WHC and achieve over 80% completeness through peer evaluation.

resources: Access to digital game platforms for collaborative learning
Casebook on ethics in science education

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
